overview: From 2025-10-01 to 2025-11-01, elizaos-plugins/plugin-solana had 3 new PRs (0 merged), 0 new issues, and 6 active contributors.

topPRs.title: token 2022 upgrades
topPRs.author: odilitime
topPRs.body:
<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
> [!NOTE]
> Adds Token-2022-aware token parsing (symbols, mutability, supply), batch symbol backfill, combined SPL+Token-2022 account discovery, and live wallet data updates via account subscriptions.
> 
> - **Tokens / Metadata**:
>   - Parse Token-2022 TLV metadata via `unpackMint`/extensions; derive `symbol`, `isMutable`, `supply`, and update `decimalsCache`.
>   - Fallback to Metaplex PDA parsing for symbols and mutability when TLV absent.
>   - New `getTokensSymbols(mints[])` for batched symbol lookup; `parseTokenAccounts` now accepts options and returns `symbol`, `supply`, `tokenProgram`, `isMutable`, `balanceUi` with background caching.
> - **Wallet Data**:
>   - Initialize wallet data immediately after public key load and subscribe to account changes to refresh on updates.
>   - Birdeye results now backfill missing symbols via `getTokensSymbols`.
>   - `getTokenAccountsByKeypair` now merges SPL and Token-2022 accounts, supports freshness via `notOlderThan`, and filters zero balances.
> - **Swaps**:
>   - Safer logging and amount formatting; improved post-balance diffing (including SOL sells) and decimals updates.
> - **Subscriptions / Lifecycle**:
>   - Account change subscription added; periodic updater removed from `start()`; `unsubscribeFromAccount` adjusted (RPC WS path commented out).
> - **Misc**:
>   - Minor constants/log tweaks; numeric literal cleanup; expanded SPL imports.
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit cbd9a3f24f6dce80b56e9577716e74d0cee01227. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

- New Features
  - Token-2022 TLV metadata parsing with robust token symbol extraction.
  - Public APIs to fetch token symbols for single or multiple mints.

- Improvements
  - Immediate wallet data initialization and live updates on account changes.
  - More accurate token balance parsing for classic SPL and Token-2022 with cached decimals/symbols.
  - Bulk symbol backfill when external sources lack symbols and improved caching/freshness.
  - Enhanced logging for cache/parsing flows.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

topPRs.title: fix: resolve TypeScript errors and improve logging
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

* New Features
  * App now continues in standalone mode if trading services are unavailable.
  * Added startup retry with clearer progress logs for initialization.

* Bug Fixes
  * More reliable swap execution with consistent error handling.
  * Wallet initialization is more resilient; portfolio shows $0 instead of blank when data is missing.
  * Safer token/account parsing to prevent crashes on unexpected data.

* Refactor
  * Standardized logging and improved robustness across network, encoding, and parsing paths.

* Chores
  * Bumped version to 1.2.0.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

topPRs.title: chore: add renovate configuration
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body:
- Auto-update @elizaos/* dependencies when published
- Extend shared preset from elizaOS/eliza monorepo

topContributors.summary: standujar: Focused on significant refactoring of core components, introducing a new `mentionContext` interface in `elizaos/eliza#6030` which simplified the codebase (+520/-681 lines) and improved response logic. This core change was then propagated to dependent plugins like in `elizaos-plugins/plugin-discord#19`. They also fixed a bug in `elizaos-plugins/plugin-openrouter#15` related to AI SDK v5 tool results extraction. Their activity shows a primary focus on refactoring, bug fixes, and widespread configuration updates.

0xbbjoker: This month, 0xbbjoker focused on enhancing plugin functionality and improving code maintainability within the `elizaos/eliza` repository. They delivered a key feature by adding an offset parameter for memory retrieval in the SQL plugin (elizaos/eliza#6032), a substantial change of +516/-209 lines. Additionally, they improved codebase health by removing 289 lines of unused code in a separate refactoring effort (elizaos/eliza#6029). Their work shows a dual focus on feature development and code quality, and they also supported the team through code review and comments.

wtfsayo: This month, wtfsayo focused on improving code health and repository maintenance, executing a significant code standardization and formatting refactor in elizaos/eliza#6027 (+1124/-1385 lines). They also removed obsolete development files in elizaos/eliza#6026 and expanded the plugin ecosystem by adding a new relay plugin to the registry in elizaos-plugins/registry#234. Their work shows a primary focus on bugfixes and other maintenance, touching mostly code and configuration files.

odilitime: This month, odilitime's contributions were focused on supporting the team through code review. They completed 3 reviews, approving 2 and requesting changes on 1, and left 3 comments on pull requests.

matteo-brandolino: This month, matteo-brandolino focused on identifying and reporting issues within the Eliza ecosystem. They opened a bug report concerning the Eliza CLI where imports were not being found (elizaos/eliza#6031) and contributed to discussions by commenting on two issues.
